field.name: normal diff count
field.help: initial number of actors on normal difficulty

field.name: insane diff count
field.help: initial number of actors on insane difficulty (hard difficulty is midway between normal and insane)

field.name: sequence ID
field.help: identifies this move position as belonging to a sequence, only actors whose starting locations match this sequence ID can use it (zero = no sequence)

field.name: swarm count
field.help: number of cretures in swarm if a swarm is spawned at this location

field.help: number of cretures in swarm if a swarm is spawned at this location

field.help: before doing anything else, the actor will travel the given distance in its forward direction

field.name: animation graph
field.help: leave this blank to use the unit's normal animation graph

definition.entry: stop if death#this conversation will be aborted if any participant dies
stop if damaged#an actor will abort this conversation if they are damaged
stop if visible enemy#an actor will abort this conversation if they see an enemy
stop if alerted to enemy#an actor will abort this conversation if they suspect an enemy
player must be visible#this conversation cannot take place unless the participants can _see_ a nearby player
stop other actions#participants stop doing whatever they were doing in order to perform this conversation
keep trying to play#if this conversation fails initially, it will keep testing to see when it can play
player must be looking#this conversation will not start until the player is looking at one of the participants

field.name: trigger distance
field.help: distance the player must enter before the conversation can trigger

field.name: run-to-player dist
field.help: if the 'involves player' flag is set, when triggered the conversation's participant(s) will run to within this distance of the player

field.name: use this object
field.help: if a unit with this name exists, we try to pick them to start the conversation

field.name: set new name
field.help: once we pick a unit, we name it this

definition.entry: wait after until told to advance

field.name: addressee participant
field.help: this field is only used if the addressee type is 'participant'

Player shot more than X seconds ago

field.name: Desired Permutation
field.help: If non-0, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number (e.g., 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7").

field.name: ecology margin
field.help: distance from ecology boundary that creature begins to be repulsed

field.name: weight
field.help: probability of producing at this source

field.name: production frequency
field.help: How frequently boids are produced at one of the sources (limited by the max boid count)

field.name: Flock parameters
field.definition: Recommended initial values (for a sentinel-sized unit): neighborhood radius= 6.0 avoidance radius= 3 forward scale= 0.5 alignment scale= 0.5 avoidance scale= 1.0 leveling force scale= 0.1 perception angle= 120 average throttle= 0.75 maximum throttle= 1.0 position scale= 1.0 position min radius= 3 position max radius = 9

field.name: Let me give you a piece of free advice.
field.definition: Flocks with a neighborhood radius of 0 don't FLOCK, per se (in the creature-creature interaction kind of way), but they are much cheaper. The best thing is to have a non-zero radius for small flocks, and a zero radius for large flocks (or for 'flow-flocks', ones with sources and sinks that are intended to create a steady flow of something). Note also that for flocks with a 0 neighborhood radius, the parameters for avoidance, alignment, position and perception angle are ignored entirely.

field.name: neighborhood radius
field.help: distance within which one boid is affected by another

field.name: avoidance radius
field.help: distance that a boid tries to maintain from another

field.name: forward scale
field.help: weight given to boid's desire to fly straight ahead

field.name: alignment scale
field.help: weight given to boid's desire to align itself with neighboring boids

field.name: avoidance scale
field.help: weight given to boid's desire to avoid collisions with other boids, when within the avoidance radius

field.name: leveling force scale
field.help: weight given to boids desire to fly level

field.name: sink scale
field.help: weight given to boid's desire to fly towards its sinks

field.name: perception angle
field.help: angle-from-forward within which one boid can perceive and react to another

field.name: average throttle
field.help: throttle at which boids will naturally fly

field.name: maximum throttle
field.help: maximum throttle applicable

field.name: position scale
field.help: weight given to boid's desire to be near flock center

field.name: position min radius
field.help: distance to flock center beyond which an attracting force is applied

field.name: position max radius
field.help: distance to flock center at which the maximum attracting force is applied

field.name: movement weight threshold
field.help: The threshold of accumulated weight over which movement occurs

field.name: danger radius
field.help: distance within which boids will avoid a dangerous object (e.g. the player)

field.name: danger scale
field.help: weight given to boid's desire to avoid danger

field.name: Perlin noise parameters
field.definition: Recommended initial values: random offset scale= 0.2 offset period bounds= 1, 3

field.name: random offset scale
field.help: weight given to boid's random heading offset
